availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Morgan County, Illinois, resident. Kentucky native. Son of James Pulliam and Jenetta Pulliam. Attended school in Anderson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Morgan County, Illinois, in 1860. Charged with the murder of James Burns in Morgan County in 1864. Fugitive from justice in Kentucky from 1864 to 1865. Arrested in Kentucky in 1865. Extradited to Illinois in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 222A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Morgan County, Sulphur Springs, p. 664.
"Jacksonville Correspondence," The Illinois State Journal (Springfield, Illinois) July 25, 1865, p. 2.
KYR-0001-006-0040.
KYR-0001-006-0041.
